cwd.description: The directory from which bower should run. All relative paths will be calculated according to this setting.

directory.description: The directory from which bower should run. All relative paths will be calculated according to this setting.

json.description: A file path to the Bower configuration file

search.description: An array of URLs pointing to read-only Bower registries. A string means only one. When looking into the registry for an endpoint, Bower will query these registries by the specified order.

register.description: The URL to use when registering packages.

publish.description: The URL to use when publishing packages.

proxy.description: The proxy to use for http requests.

https-proxy.description: The proxy to use for https requests.

user-agent.description: Sets the User-Agent for each request made.

timeout.description: he timeout to be used when making requests in milliseconds.

strict-ssl.description: Whether or not to do SSL key validation when making requests via https.

ca.description: The CA certificates to be used, defaults to null. This is similar to the registry key, specifying each CA to use for each registry endpoint.

color.description: Enable or disable use of colors in the CLI output.

storage.description: Where to store persistent data, such as cache, needed by bower.

tmp.description: Where to store temporary files and folders

interactive.description: Makes bower interactive, prompting whenever necessary
